revised_title: Observations of the 1761 Vesuvius Eruption and Its Impacts
tldr: In 1761, Sir Francis Haskins Eyles Stiles observed the eruption of Mount Vesuvius and its effects on the surrounding area. He described the eruption's progression, including the smoke column, lava flow, and explosions. Stiles also discussed the potential impacts on Naples and the duration of the eruption.
